question: What amount of funds (in Rupees) has been sucked out of the financial system by RBI through its recent Reverse REPO operation?
explanation:
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has recently drained Rs 2 trillion of liquidity from the system using its 14-day reverse repo auction.
This is a part of Reserve Bankâ€™s process of normalising liquidity operations. The present Reverse Repo rate is 3.35%, while the cut off rate for the said auction was set at 3.55%. RBI has stated that it has got bids worth Rs 3.06 trillion.
